required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Open-Label Phase 1/2 Study of VELCADE for Injection in Patients With Light-chain (AL)-Amyloidosis
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label Phase 1/2 Study of VELCADE for Injection in Subjects With Light-Chain (AL)-Amyloidosis

collaborator.agency: Johnson & Johnson Pharmaceutical Research & Development, L.L.C.

brief_summary.textblock: This is a phase 1/2 open-label, dose-escalation study investigating single-agent therapy with VELCADE in patients with previously treated systemic AL-amyloidosis who require further treatment.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 5 weeks in once weekly (QW) dose cohorts and 3 weeks in twice weekly (BIW) dose cohorts
primary_outcome.description: Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) was defined as the highest dose level that has 0/1 out of 6 patients experiences Dose Limited Toxicity (DLT). MTD is defined separately for QW and BIQ dose cohorts. DLT was defined as adverse events occurring during Cycle 1 and: (1) related to VELCADE, (2) Grade 4 thrombocytopenia or neutropenia, (3) Grade 3 or higher nonhematologic toxicity.

primary_outcome.measure: Subjects With Treatment Emergent Adverse Events
primary_outcome.time_frame: from first study-related procedure to 30 days after last dose of study medication
primary_outcome.description: Treatment emergent adverse events observed during outcome measure time frame

primary_outcome.measure: Subjects With Serious Treatment Emergent Adverse Events
primary_outcome.time_frame: from first study-related procedure to 30 days after last dose of study medication
primary_outcome.description: Serious treatment emergent adverse events observed during outcome measure time frame

primary_outcome.measure: Subjects Grade 3/4/5 Treatment Emergent Adverse Events
primary_outcome.time_frame: from first study-related procedure to 30 days after last dose of study medication
primary_outcome.description: Grade 3/4/5 treatment emergent adverse events observed during outcome measure time frame. Grade is determined according to Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Event (CTCAE) Version 3.0.

primary_outcome.measure: Subjects With Treatment Emergent Adverse Events Leading to Treatment Termination
primary_outcome.time_frame: from first study-related procedure to 30 days after last dose of study medication
primary_outcome.description: Treatment emergent adverse events observed during outcome measure time frame leading to treatment termination

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from first dose of study medication to end of study visit
secondary_outcome.description: Hematologic response was determined by the investigator per the response criteria for immunoglobulin light chain amyloidosis by Gertz (2005). It include Complete and Partial Responders (CR+PR). CR requires serum and urine negative for a monoclonal protein by immunofixation and free light chain ratio normal. PR requires: 1. reduction in quantitative serum M-protein by 50% if baseline value is at least 0.5 g/dL, 2. if light chain is detected in the urine (with a consistent peak and >100 mg/ 24 hours), then 50% reduction is required, 3. if free light chain >10 mg/dL, reduction by 50% is required.

intervention.description: Once weekly at: 0.7, 1.0, 1.3 or 1.6 mg/m2 Or Twice-weekly at: 0.7, 1.0, or 1.3 mg/m2

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Male or Female 18 y/o and older
2. Female patients must be practicing an effective method of birth control
3. Biopsy-proven AL-amyloidosis
4. Must have been previously treated (failed at least 1 previous treatment) and in the opinion of the physician, patient requires further treatment
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Hypersensitivity to boron or mannitol
2. Prior treatment with VELCADE
3. Patient requires other concomitant chemotherapy, radiotherapy or ancillary therapy considered investigational
4. Uncontrolled infection

facility.name: Cedars-Sinai Medical Center, Samuel Oschin Comprehensive Cancer Institute
Winship Cancer Center - Emory Clinic School of Medicine

group.title: Single Agent VELCADE
group.description: Bortezomib 0.7, 1.0, 1.3 and 1.6 mg/m^2 once weekly (QW) 4 doses in a 5 week cycle, and 0.7, 1.0, 1.3 mg/m^2 twice weekly (BIW) 4 doses in a 3 week cycle

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Deterioration in KPS and organ function

group.title: Single Agent VELCADE
group.description: Bortezomib 0.7, 1.0, 1.3 and 1.6 mg/m^2 once weekly (QW) 4 doses in a 5 week cycle, and 0.7, 1.0, 1.3 mg/m^2 twice weekly (BIW) 4 doses in a 3 week cycle

outcome.title: Maximum Tolerated Dose
outcome.description: Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) was defined as the highest dose level that has 0/1 out of 6 patients experiences Dose Limited Toxicity (DLT). MTD is defined separately for QW and BIQ dose cohorts. DLT was defined as adverse events occurring during Cycle 1 and: (1) related to VELCADE, (2) Grade 4 thrombocytopenia or neutropenia, (3) Grade 3 or higher nonhematologic toxicity.
outcome.time_frame: 5 weeks in once weekly (QW) dose cohorts and 3 weeks in twice weekly (BIW) dose cohorts
outcome.population: Phase 1 Safety Population includes all subjects who received at least one dose of VELCADE in phase 1 dose escalation cohorts

MTD is defined separately for QW and BIQ dose cohorts. DLT was defined as adverse events occurring during Cycle 1 and: (1) related to VELCADE, (2) Grade 4 thrombocytopenia or neutropenia, (3) Grade 3 or higher nonhematologic toxicity.

outcome.title: Best Confirmed Hematologic Responders
outcome.description: Hematologic response was determined by the investigator per the response criteria for immunoglobulin light chain amyloidosis by Gertz (2005). It include Complete and Partial Responders (CR+PR). CR requires serum and urine negative for a monoclonal protein by immunofixation and free light chain ratio normal. PR requires: 1. reduction in quantitative serum M-protein by 50% if baseline value is at least 0.5 g/dL, 2. if light chain is detected in the urine (with a consistent peak and >100 mg/ 24 hours), then 50% reduction is required, 3. if free light chain >10 mg/dL, reduction by 50% is required.
outcome.time_frame: from first dose of study medication to end of study visit
outcome.population: Efficacy population included all treated subjects with an evaluable post baseline resposne assessment in the MTD cohorts (1.6 mg/m^2 QW and 1.3 mg/m^2 BIW).

measure.description: Hematologic response was determined by the investigator per the response criteria for immunoglobulin light chain amyloidosis by Gertz (2005). It include Complete and Partial Responders (CR+PR). CR requires serum and urine negative for a monoclonal protein by immunofixation and free light chain ratio normal. PR requires: 1. reduction in quantitative serum M-protein by 50% if baseline value is at least 0.5 g/dL, 2. if light chain is detected in the urine (with a consistent peak and >100 mg/ 24 hours), then 50% reduction is required, 3. if free light chain >10 mg/dL, reduction by 50% is required.
measure.population: Efficacy population included all treated subjects with an evaluable post baseline resposne assessment in the MTD cohorts (1.6 mg/m^2 QW and 1.3 mg/m^2 BIW).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
